website_summaries.verdict: The sluggish performance of the Nokia 6 is a nuisance, but its low price and good looks go a long way to make up for it.
pros: The Nokia 6's slick metal jacket looks great, givin this affordable phone the lustre of a more premium handset
cons: The underpowered processor makes the phone sometimes frustrating to use

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on Amazon July 2017, it stopped working March 29, 2018. When I bought this phone it empathized that it came with a 12 month warranty. I contacted Nokia and I received a reply saying that when this Nokia 6 phone is purchased through Amazon.com and it does not work it should be returned to Nokia within 14 days of receiving your phone. Nokia do not stand by their so called warranty, I paid $229 of my hard earned money, Nokia needs to tell the truth about what they sell on Amazon. I advise all who are thinking about buying this phone to think twice before wasting your money, good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: Great value for money. Extremely solid build. Premium feel in hand.
customer_reviews.author: N. Ram

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working shortly after the warranty ran out
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in February and it’s now July - phone won’t turn on anymore and the return window has closed 🤬 While it did work here is what I liked: - frequent os updates. - great battery life - decent screen - loud sound - looks and feels premium What I didn’t like: - stopped working - slow performance - would often seize up for several seconds even with few apps on ( just WhatsApp, Facebook, google maps, outlook etc.
customer_reviews.author: Sheheryar Channah

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, switched from iphone
customer_reviews.text: Good phone, I'm switching from iphone. the fingerprint scanner works great you can scan different fingers. Touch screen is responsive and plenty of memory for me, I actually have some games on mine, from radiation island to double dragon. So it runs very well to handle the games I play. I don't like the messaging app or the calling app that come with the phone, but that is easily rectified. The lack of a wallet app sucks, but the google wallet is a fine substitute.If you are coming from android then I would definitely say buy it. It also worked seamlessly with my Canadian sim card, so any american sim running GSM should work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jamal

customer_reviews.title: For the price it is a solid phone. Not ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price it is a solid phone. Not top of the line fastest thing - but will work well with all basic apps in daily use. The option for an SD card to expand storage is a must if you take lots of pictures and store media physically on your phone - it's a hard feature to find on phones as of late. Really solidly built and paired with a decent care - unless dropped on the screen, it'll hold up well. Excited that Nokia is manufacturing again! Will probably upgrade to another Nokia at some point as soon as a model comes out with a Zeiss camera lens again - which I've read is in the works.
customer_reviews.author: AArtVark

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: Purchasing from this seller was fine, but NOKIA DOES NOT HONOR THIER WARRANTY! I purchased this phone on July of 2018, and the battery/phone stopped holding a charge 6 months later. Nokia had me try a number of operations to determine if the problem was app related, which was reasonable, and I complied. After going through this twice, I asked that Nokia either replace or repair the battery or phone. I was told that they had to pass the information along. It has now been over 1 year, and they have done nothing. I WILL NEVER BUY A PRODUCT MADE BY NOKIA AGAIN. This sounds like venting, but my intent is CONSUMER AWAREBESS. PLEASE LOOK TO OTHER MANUFACTURES.
customer_reviews.author: Kay M.

customer_reviews.title: I Still Love it Enough i bought a second one.
customer_reviews.text: The changes from the original camera to the latest of Android Pie for Nokia 6 2017 are drastically changed quality of photos never changed decent camera, good battery life if not "DoA or issues", yet to see from the start of the 8.1.0 update sound issues are still on the latest 9.0 android update but it's been known to blast audio from video at the lowest settings and then ring quiet as a mouse on full ring volume. (Verified works on USA T-mobile Band 12) so T-Mobile is fully supported unlike some unlocked devices that frequently lie with "half support"
customer_reviews.author: K. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Not the Nokia of old.
customer_reviews.text: Nokia wass always been my phone brand of choice when I was Windows Phones. I have had this phone as my daily driver for almost a year, after moving to Android. I loved it when I first bought it, but it hasn't stood the test of time. The screen has burn in and dark spots and the phone crashes and has to be rebooted a couple times a week. I expect more from nokia and won't be purchasing from them again.
customer_reviews.author: ECW Fan

customer_reviews.title: Decent overall; TERRIBLE sound quality for media
customer_reviews.text: Overall a workable phone- not as fast as some of the newer models but decent speed for the price. Battery life is strong as well- if you charge every night you'll have enough power to get through the day with no issues, even with heavy use. The only downside is the sound quality for media- constant, and I mean CONSTANT, low level static either from its own speaker or even through headphones. I don't totally understand why because call quality is fine. If you use your phone heavily for music, podcasts, etc, this is not the phone for you. No matter what, it sounds like you're listening to music through broken headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Clare Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: I cant seem to get away from Nokia
customer_reviews.text: I finally made the change from a Windows phone to this nice phone. If you have been holding out like me, this is the phone to get. I am used to paying $100.00 for Windows Lumias, there is no way I am paying $800 for a phone in 2018. I found this phone on accident, it had good enough reviews for a cell phone so I gave it a try. Windows phone users are a marginal bunch, we are like an outcast tribe, hanging on to past traditions...This is the phone to make the transition. I have only had it a week.
customer_reviews.author: Randy W

customer_reviews.title: What an amazing phone!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've read reviews on different websites regarding this phone,camera was supposed to be not the best, I've not had that experience. The camera app is a little slow, taking pics is not. Phone updated to Android 8.1, updates were fast & thorough. Package that the phone came in was very compact & well designed. Sound wasn't the best until I turned off Dolby setting, now things are much better. Overall build for this phone is great, you can tell it's a very sturdy phone, love the wall papers that come with the phone. I haven't encountered any issues with the phone so far & I'm really not expecting to any time in the future.
customer_reviews.author: William Castle

customer_reviews.title: Nokia has done it again
customer_reviews.text: The first time I fell in love with Nokia, was my still working N900. I loved it so much I bought the N9 when it came out. Then Nokia went to Windows OS for their phones and I left them in the dust:( But now Nokia is using a legit OS again. Android is miles better than windows junky os. And honestly, far better than IOS. And the simple fact that Nokia, once again, packs this device with hardware easily as good as the thousand dollar cell's out there ripping people off. I like her new phone so much I want one of my own. And you will too once you get a chance to try it out!
customer_reviews.author: Hooligan

customer_reviews.title: This phone works well for me but not at my home
customer_reviews.text: I really like the dual-SIM feature of this phone, which works very nicely. Sometimes, when traveling, I use the phone with one SIM card and an SD memory card, and this configuration also works well. I did not realize that, before buying a phone, I needed to check the mobile bands that are transmitted by the cell towers near my home. As a result, my T-Mobile service works almost everywhere I go, but not at my home-- the Nokia does not receive the frequencies transmitted by T-Mobile near my home. By contrast, my AT&T service works fine with this phone.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chaiken

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!! PHONE IN DEAD STATE AFTER LITTLE TIME!
customer_reviews.text: Nokia all of a sudden died after just 4 months, I bought it in May as I thought I found a good deal on it for around $200 for a brand new smart phone. Gifted it to my mother a few months later. And she used it until it crashed at the beginning of December. It all of a sudden just turned off on her, after attempting to charge it, it will still not power on. It's her first smart phone, she uses it for texting and phone calls. Memory didn't even take a dent, as she did not have any apps or games installed. Now I'm short $200 and a working phone.
customer_reviews.author: Subhash Thadikamalla

customer_reviews.title: Not a very user friendly phone at all.
customer_reviews.text: I've only had phone 3 days and don't care for it at all. Can't hear very well at all when phone held up to ear on regular non-speaker call. Friends complain can't hear me properly on speaker calls. Active battery Life is poor. When charge level of battery gets low phone dies abruptly with no warning. Screen display goes into a split continually without requesting this. I don't care at the way contact search is for texting and calling. Out of all these phones I've never owned this is hardest way to find and attach pictures to text.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe that this phone only cost $109.00 USD. I have a lot of apps running on this phone and it never freezes... The only thing I don't like about this phone is that it is a dual sim phone but if you use a sd card then it is basically single sim because the sd card occupies the slot for the 2nd sim card. Otherwise I am completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Ashton Ramlogan

customer_reviews.title: This is the best 200$ phone around period
customer_reviews.text: This is the best 200$ phone around period. You want that bare-bones android experience? This is it and its got great construction and quality. I don't even have a case on this thing because....why not I can actually afford to replace it in a year or 2 when I will want to anyways. This is how cellphones should be, affordable, efficient , and still capable.
customer_reviews.author: Roronoa Zoro

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, below average speakers.
customer_reviews.text: The phone is good for the price.cmy dad has an awful time taking care of phones, so we don't go out buying him expensive phones. One thing my dad is adamant about having, is a powerful speaker. I got him this Nokia, because they a famous for being "indestructible", and ir advertised powerful speakers. I docked a star because the speakers are not loud at all.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Great International Travel Phone But Cannot Have Two SIMS and Micro SD
customer_reviews.text: Given to a friend who travels a lot. Has a T-Mobile US number and needs a second SIM slot for international use. The phone automatically upgraded to Android 9 upon power up. No issues with that. Be forewarned: this phone gives you a choice of EITHER one nano-SIM and one Micro SD cards OR two nano-SIM cards. So using both SIM slots requires giving up Micro SD storage. That's why I'm rating this three stars instead of four.
customer_reviews.author: JP KazarianTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Nokia 6
customer_reviews.text: buying this Nokia 6, is the best thing that could have happened to me. I had the Galaxy Note 5, but I gave up on continuing to repair it: spend on battery, broken screen, everything is expensive, it is not original, there are details. What can I say the chassis is entirely in aluminum, copper color the finishing of edges with silver edges, I want to mourn with happiness, I listen to some Nokia tones and other very innovative ones .. Long lasting battery, works great here in Paraguay. It is very unique Nokia Android operating system, for these latitudes. I already bought it with transparent silicone sleeve, highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Jose Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, clean android and fast
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, clean android and fast I gave this as a gift to my mom who had an old Microsoft phone before. She left her new samsung phone and chose this instead. This phone is much faster because of the clean android it has. Battery lasts long enuf for her.
customer_reviews.author: Vj

customer_reviews.title: pay attention to the required sim card if updating phone
customer_reviews.text: Phone updated to 8.1 within two hrs of being activated, smooth operation. Copper is nice and phone looks and feels premium. Be aware that a nano sim is used and my previous sim from the last 3 phones will not work. Instantly linked to my hr steel activity watch and the info from todays worlput is accurate, sleep info was correct. An excellent phone and system, and a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Terry H

customer_reviews.title: Nokia does Android Well
customer_reviews.text: As Androids distros go, this one is pretty decent. Hardware is decent also. Got updated to 8.1 pretty quickly. Wish I read closer that it would be so Amazon-centric. I already spend too much on Amazon so having the phone constantly steer me there is annoying. Nokia makes a good phone and this is definitely good at the price point. Just be ready for Ads
customer_reviews.author: AndyW

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for the kids! Blue version was only $109 at time of purchase
customer_reviews.text: I know as a budget phone it obviously has it pros and its cons but buying 2 of the blue version for $109 each for our 10 yr old twin boys was an excellent decision! More then enough power for them to play their games but even more important the durability of this phone has been great due to the full aluminum body paired with gorrila glass! Both phones survived a few drops even before getting protective cases. Both boys are also in love with how nice these phones look and how well the screens look. The only major downfall for them is they can not play fortnite on these...
customer_reviews.author: StameFam

customer_reviews.title: Great value at such an affordable price!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome phone. Superb product for the price. Allowed me to quit the Samsung brand and return to my preferred brand with the best of both worlds - Android and Microsoft. The size and weight are user friendly for texting, reading and watching. The problem across all the Nokia smartphones continues to be the unexpected freezing of the phone. Hope they fix this kink soon.
customer_reviews.author: Ange

customer_reviews.title: Cant get logged into anything
customer_reviews.text: Very nice phone . It's definitely heavy duty. I You'll need a case for sure bc it a very slick. Hard to hold onto. I've only had it for 4 days and I have yet to really use it. I keep going bk to old phone bc internet works and then doesn't. I can't get signed into any of my accts. Even with codes. That I know I'm putting in correctly. Been a big pain. I hope once I get it working right it will be a good phone.
customer_reviews.author: Felecia

customer_reviews.title: Decent phone, underpowered processor
customer_reviews.text: Very good, except I took off a star for the processor. It's a snapdragon, but the processor is underrated for this price range in my opinion. The 400-series is more of a $100 phone. I would not buy again. You have to find a phone with the 600 or 800 series snapdragon, in my opinion. What got me here was the amount of cores, but it still is sluggish and slow even with a lot of cores. The phone is still priced competitively, and it is still a good phone by Nokia. It is a very good attempt to get back into the market after the Microsoft phones were dropped by ... Microsoft.
customer_reviews.author: MF

customer_reviews.title: Nice Finnish
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine. Call quality is very good and 'ear piece' is audible at a variety of angles and distances. Screen is nice, a bit large if you operate the phone with a single hand/thumb but a large screen has its obvious advantages. Interface is snappy for everyday tasks (I'm not gaming with the phone). Camera seems average to good but not incredible. FM Radio is an added bonus (when you attach the supplied ear plugs as an antenna). Sound quality of the supplied ear plugs is not good but I have my own. Fingerprint scanner works very well. Battery lasts sufficiently long. Capable and usable phone with a nice build quality and Finnish.
customer_reviews.author: Wendover

customer_reviews.title: Dropped Calls
customer_reviews.text: This hardware on this phone is gorgeous. It really is a great looking phone. But here's the deal breakers: (1) it drops calls a lot; (2) the auto-rotate is glitchy; and (3) phone calls sometimes start on speaker even though the speaker icon indicates it isn't activated, requiring one to turn the speaker on and then off again to disable it in the call. I really wanted to love this phone. Sadly, I will be returning it and looking for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cassada

customer_reviews.title: Worst phone I've bought in a long time!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This phone is constantly freezing and making apps crash all the time, the phone is slow as a snail. It will take several seconds from the time I press the button to turn it on until the screen actually turns on, I'll press the square button for the app currently running to pop up and it will take 10 or 15 seconds if it actually decides to pop up. Apps crash all the time, phone freezes all the time, ive had it a month and it is the worst phone I've ever owned, I should have gotten a Samsung Galaxy instead for a few bucks more! It works good sometimes but most of the time it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Adair

customer_reviews.title: Find a different phone, any phone
customer_reviews.text: Don't let this phone update to Android 9. The hardware will constantly lag, even during calls, even after a factory reset. Screen freezes and unresponsive touch even if it isn't frozen are common. You also lose Dolby Atmos functionality, even though the option is there. General problems: The phone overheats easily. Charging is a chore if you aren't in the 68 to 72 degree range. Is it 80? Too hot to charge. Is it 40? Too cold to charge. In the rare times the phone does work, it's nice. The large screen and thin profile are nice. Too bad the rest of it is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie E. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone as a gift for my husband. He couldn't be happier! He could finally do everything he had been wanting to do but his phone was too weak and old to handle. I also bought one for my mom. It's so powerful she doesn't quite know what to do with it. When she took it into the Cricket store they were blown away by how good of a phone it was and mentioned that they didn't even sell it there at the store.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Good performance for the money
customer_reviews.text: If you want to pick the phone which gives you the best bang for the buck then in my opinion this is a very good contender. I do like the screen and the fact that performance wise is doing everything I need it to do. As an example, the Sygic application is running smoothly and the phone doesn't heat up and the battery consumption is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Radu Ungureanu

customer_reviews.title: Has some drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: Screen is way too big. It's a pain to hold. Typing on keyboard difficult. Photos are soft in focus. Volume is way too loud. Watching YouTube videos on the lowest setting next to mute and it's blasting. Battery is good. I need something smaller with a better camera. Price is good but I'm not sure what to do. May return.
customer_reviews.author: Ciarrai

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Smartphone
customer_reviews.text: Really difficult to find fault with this phone, especially for the price. I like the audio quality (I stream a lot of music) and the clean up-to-date Android OS. No bloatware, just Google apps which is fine. Sure, you can get faster chipsets for this price range, but this phone seems plenty speedy to me. I opted for build quality. This phone is really solidly built, and really nice looking. Some critics kind of bashed the camera but I think that's nit-picking. I have no complaints with image quality or camera function. Also, the display is beautiful... love this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Eli Nazzaro

customer_reviews.title: Brick
customer_reviews.text: I was specifically looking for an unbreakable phone, and so far this one fits the bill. Aluminum body is awesome. I don't have a case on it, have dropped it a handful of times, and it only has a few dings on the corners. Had mine for 6 months and the battery life is still pretty good. I'll kill it in an hour or two if I'm playing games, but for normal use it lasts 30-40 hrs.
customer_reviews.author: FlameEverlasting

customer_reviews.title: Nokia 6, 10 months later
customer_reviews.text: I'm a novice phone user. I mainly text and call on this phone. Right off the bat it is a beautiful phone. (I got the copper). But, the phone has some weight to it. It hurt my hands/ wrists, causing cramps. The battery does not last for even a day. I also was not impressed with the camera. Impossible to get true color pics. On the upside, and not having it in a case, I've dropped this phone at least 5 times and nothing happened to it. It landed screen side down every single time too, 3 times on stone tile! No cracks at all. Try that with an iphone. NOT.
customer_reviews.author: Dane

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -The build quality is very good and feels great in the hand. -The screen is bright and looks good -The speakers sound excellent -Battery life is sufficient to get thru a day without recharging -Almost completely stock Android -Camera is decent -Fingerprint sensor for added security Cons: -Kind of laggy due to the 430 chipset -No notification light -Mini USB rather than type C Overall I am happy with this device. You truly get a lot for a minimum price point.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Haber

customer_reviews.title: Problem with receiver hear
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my girlfriend in Ghana. Went to Ghana on the 4th of February 2019 and gave the phone to her. I came back to New York on the 15th of February. I've been trying to video chat with her but she can't here hear me unless I make a voice call. She's given to a tech personnel but can't fix it. She's reset it and did all the settings but to no avail. What's happening? What should she do?
customer_reviews.author: KWAME AFRIFA

customer_reviews.title: Died without warning!
customer_reviews.text: I got it 9 February 2019. It died 6 August 2019 without warning. Although it has a year warranty. I'm outside of Amazon's support window. So I'll have to drop a few hundred dollars at a cellphone today after work. Please save your money, time and purchase something else. from someone else. CellPort's response can take up to 2 business days, Lol, like I can wait to that long between each back and forth message. My phone is apart of my job. I can't even call 911 or roadside assistance in an emergency right now if I needed to.
customer_reviews.author: DKW

customer_reviews.title: Android
customer_reviews.text: The phone seems to be fine. Other than receiving a European type plug for charging instead of a US type plug it has been good, never had an Android before, always Windows phones
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this phone December 2018 for Christmas. The function of the phone was great for about the first 3 months. Then, when making calls, people complained that they can't hear me. Had to use the phone on speaker. (that was the first sign that it was not going to be a good product). Next, the phone would not stay charged. Then one day, it had 20% power and it shut off. Never to turn back on again. This phone is too expensive to last 3 months. Would not recommend the product to anyone. The warranty is poor, doesn't cover any of these problems. Waste of time trying to get it fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda

customer_reviews.title: My NOKIA is a gift to myself
customer_reviews.text: Yo. This is a gift to myself I love. It's sturdy and I haven't broke it yet. Started with Verizon, but had to throw down on another carrier and re-found this gift to myself and it was my best present. : ) And I'm with AT&T with this phone with no problems. And they think it's great. : )
customer_reviews.author: Electric Apes a Me

customer_reviews.title: Good phone with a bad camera
customer_reviews.text: Seems like the swipe functionality is inferior to the Galaxy, and also the camera seems dark and borders on unusable, which is why I docked two stars. Other than that, it does everything I need it to.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Bond

customer_reviews.title: Junk!!
customer_reviews.text: I really like Nokia products. I was super excited to get this phone and use on the AT&T network. Well everything was fine until today. Phone bricked while fully charged. From day one this phone has been in a case and screen protector. Today just about 66 days since I received, the phone is just dead and will not reboot. I've tried all the tricks and nothing works. Only a 30 day warranty fro the seller. Would suggest any Samsung product instead. Thats what I am going to do.
customer_reviews.author: paul coble

customer_reviews.title: This was my first new smart phone is quite a while
customer_reviews.text: This was my first new smart phone is quite a while, so take this review with perspective of someone who is used to older slower models. I really enjoy this phone.It has some heft to it, but not too bulky. Easy fits in pockets and car chargers. I did get a case and screen protector which I would recommend as it is a bit brittle.So far no issues with anything, even dropped it once and not an issue. Very good batter life, have been playing an online game on it to death lately and it does not run out of juice all day. phone quality was good, just a little quite on the speaker function.
customer_reviews.author: bronyguy

customer_reviews.title: I freaking love this phone
customer_reviews.text: I freaking love this phone. It feels like an expensive phone and it even performs as well as my old HTC 10. I love that it isn't loaded down with bloatware and it just plain works. I went from paying Verizon $70+ a month to Walmart Family Mobile for more data at half the price. Porting my number was easy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley D Watkins

customer_reviews.title: That's about the best I can say
customer_reviews.text: The phone works. That's about the best I can say. But having more than one big app open (spotify and google maps, for instance) and it just lags and one of the apps often crashes. So, I try to avoid multi-tasking and just do one thing at a time. I bought two Huawei 6x phones around the same time for my kids and despite the fact that the specs are pretty similar, this one works nowhere nearly as well as theirs. I do find that photos are pretty good, even if the camera itself can be slow to boot up. Certainly won't buy another Nokia!
customer_reviews.author: Luke Martin

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative to a Windows Phone
customer_reviews.text: So far I've enjoyed my experience with this Nokia 6 phone, coming from a old Windows Phone I've noticed no lags or malfunctions, in fact the phone is very responsive and fast, finger print scanner is fast too, the battery since I don't use it as much during my work day, it lasts almost two days for me. Very recommended. P.S. I've just noticed a few issues with the Bluetooth since it appears to turn on automatically, and I need to turn it off, but it occurs sporadically.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Roberto Navas Giron

customer_reviews.title: Thought I was a good product - I was wrong.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife last July and it work until last last Monday when the home button and the right button stopped working. I did some troubleshooting and called Nokia, nothing. I called Amazon and after 50 minutes troubleshooting the device Amazon offered me $100 less than what I paid. I have never given a bad review or had issues with Amazon before. This is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: BryanP.

customer_reviews.title: Complete Trash
customer_reviews.text: Dolby speakers stopped working 2 weeks after started using it. A week after that phone froze and when the battery got drained it never turned back on. Don't waste your money. Nokia is not what it used to be.
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo Remon

customer_reviews.title: Nokia equals quality.
customer_reviews.text: Well the phone is a solid performer. Screen size is good for my hand and fits nicely in my pocket. The photo quality is good as well as the video quality. Having the new Android go edition means you'll be zipping along. The sound quality of calls is clear and quite good. The price is not a budget breaker either. If you're looking for a nonsense cell with decent battery life and great performance, it's a buy.
customer_reviews.author: Rochester B. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: This phone is a great value
customer_reviews.text: Once again Nokia proves itself in terms of its transceiver sensitivity. I get bars in data connections in places that my Samsung just can't hang tough. It is ironic to have to tether my Samsung to the hotspot on my Nokia in order to transmit data in marginal conditions. The $600 phone is dependent upon the $100 phone to connect to the outside world. I could live with just this Nokia and its shortcomings in terms of the intensity of the screen. The dual-sim is also a nice feature I have my AT&T and my mint mobile Sims in there and I've been comparing the performance for almost a month so far they seem to be identical.
customer_reviews.author: PhilDab

customer_reviews.title: Okay for it's Price
customer_reviews.text: For someone that needs the basic uses of a phone - this is it! Pros: Durable phone (if you drop phones frequently, this is the phone for you), good customer service since this is sold by Amazon, nice looking?, haha can't think of any of pros. Downsides: Camera quality isn't great, speaker phone does not work!!- volume is very low when you place it on speaker
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer defect
customer_reviews.text: So far I am experiencing great problems with one of these phones which I am very displeased about. Not even a month old and I it have been over heating and the key pad is not responding so disappointing, I need this to be rectify asap.
customer_reviews.author: kendell

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad deal!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone almost 2 years ago. With this price, you wont feel like a loser after buying this. It's a fair deal. Some of the pros are following: a) It does not hang, b) Sufficient inbuilt memory, c) Strong (it fell out of my hand many times but still working good). Some of the cons are following: a) low battery life and b) higher charging time.
customer_reviews.author: RAHUL KUMAR

customer_reviews.title: Need a junk phone? This is it.
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. Locks up for about 10 seconds fairly constantly. Scrolling up or down happens 1/2" at a time. I'm about ready to throw it away and buy a decent phone.
customer_reviews.author: Old guy in Loveland

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a family member who had already had a plan. She absolutely loves this phone. I'm really pleased with how nice the phone was for the price that we got it for. It's not fancy but it is really good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: goddesshall

customer_reviews.title: Much Value, Such Wow Nokia - Android & Nokia!!!
customer_reviews.text: So far I am very impressed by this $200 phone. I use the pixel everyday currently, so I do notice slowness compared to that, but it holds its own for sure. Camera processing sucks though. It is average to below average...but I think software updates could address this if Nokia wanted to.
customer_reviews.author: N C

customer_reviews.title: Good price works ok
customer_reviews.text: Nice price but features are limited,sound is the worst and settings are hard to navigate.
customer_reviews.author: don magness

customer_reviews.title: warranty suck
customer_reviews.text: great phone, solid built. was happy with it until power button stopped working and realizing that warranty is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene

customer_reviews.title: Good phone but not for me
customer_reviews.text: I needed a phone for an extra sim that I had. It was difficult to switch to this as an iPhone user. It was a good phone, but I ended up going back to the iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: CMU

customer_reviews.title: Great phone - almost flawless on AT&T network
customer_reviews.text: Excellent phone. Works fine with AT&T (postpaid) account. LTE, VoLTE both work. WiFi calling does NOT work, apparently AT&T only supports WiFi calling on branded devices, which this is not. SIM1 has a short number, 1 digit shorter than normal. Some AT&T techs don't know that this is OK. Battery life is good. Ringtones are not great, Samsung has better ringtones. But, this is stock Android!
customer_reviews.author: Amrith

customer_reviews.title: Very Pretty Phone
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this phone not expecting much since it was so reasonably priced. When I opened it , it was a REALLY great looking phone. Sadly I returned it only because my friend gave me their old phone for free , so I cannot comment on anything other than the look.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquilyn Alakoski

customer_reviews.title: Nokia is back into business !!
customer_reviews.text: My first mobile was nokia 3300 back in 2003 and now I see the same quality from nokia.. best battery back up and crisp and clear picture .. awesome phone and a good prime offer !
customer_reviews.author: Hemant

customer_reviews.title: Will not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Don't like the on and off bottoms, it take a long time to come on almost three to five minutes, not happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Aurora

customer_reviews.title: The phone did not last 2 months. Started having ...
customer_reviews.text: The phone did not last 2 months. Started having battery problems after a month. Required the phone to be restarted every-time a charger was plugged in. I purchased 2 nokia 6 phones and had the same issue on both the devices. Does anyone know how can i get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: There was a smooth and fast.delivery of the phone
customer_reviews.text: The phone arrived but it is not what I expected based on the following. Dual SIM is not in side the phone and the phone doesnt have a provission for a replaceable battery. I am used to using a phone with a replaceable battery . I am returning the phone back as it didnt.meet my expection
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good looking but died out in 5 month.
customer_reviews.text: Dual SIM works, only if I could use both sim for texting also. ADDITION: Phone died out offer 5 months of use. Screen don't work. No response at all. No return after 30 days, remember.
customer_reviews.author: Paposhia

customer_reviews.title: Nokia Forever
customer_reviews.text: I like the picture quality, I like the sleek design as well as the speed of the operating system. Updating my review. My Nokia starting to give me issues as it doesn't want to accept a charge anymore. Lowering from a 5 star to 4 🌟
customer_reviews.author: Marv.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. I have had this phone for 3 months and now I have to buy a new one. Out of nowhere, the phone turned off and wouldn't turn back on. It had charged all night and had a full battery when I awoke. 2 hours later it was as dead as a door nail. Wont charge or do anything. Before that, the phone kept freezing up. Of course, there is only a month warranty and no support available.
customer_reviews.author: 3lmom

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I think overall a good purchase for the price. Speaker phone a little disappointing, but on the other hand, the speakers produce good sound for media. Probably the separation for Dolby acheived. And I like the camera and video quality.
customer_reviews.author: neokansan

customer_reviews.title: Too slow for 1 month old phone!
customer_reviews.text: Look I understand that a phone as cheap as $129 cannot be expected to perform very well. But the processor is extremely slow and it is tedious to use this phone. The phone hangs once in a while and takes a long time to open apps. Even everyday regular operations on this phone are difficult. And I have bought it only one month ago. I am not sure if $130 is a good price for such a device.
customer_reviews.author: ANONYMOUS

customer_reviews.title: NOT UNLOCKED! USELESS AS A PHONE.
customer_reviews.text: This phone is NOT UNLOCKED. I bought this and couldn't figure out why my prepaid sim didn't work. Brought it to Verizon and they told me it was locked to T-Mobile. Took it to TMobile and they told me that I can't use it with them because it is connected to an account that ended on bad terms i.e. there was an unpaid bill connected to this phone. HUGE WASTE OF MONEY. I don't know if this is a stolen phone or what but I suggest not doing business with this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Customer from Saint Paul Park

customer_reviews.title: No LTE with AT&T
customer_reviews.text: The description is deceptive. The description mentions that unlocked LTE but this device did not render LTE service though my service provider is AT&T and I am in LTE area. I had to return this as I did not get expected amd mentioned service.
customer_reviews.author: Kumar G.

customer_reviews.title: 😍 Such a Beauty
customer_reviews.text: I never expected this! Really it was so good! Dolby was plus for the phone and dual speaker! Performance was really smooth. Don't need to worry battery will get through the day easily. I loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Pradeep Reddy

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Good mid tier phone. Great if you want a simple well designed smartphone. Nothing fancy, just basic.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Nokia 6 Unlocked model TA-1025
customer_reviews.text: I just got my Nokia 6, and I can confirm if you were wondering that is is the Nokia 6 Model TA-1025. Its unlocked and its working perfectly. I dont live in the US and worked 100% with LTE of Claro (Latin America). It came with Android 7.1.1 Nougat but instantly updated itself to Android 9. I couldnt be happier, planning to buy another one for the wife.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: I feel like I was robbed.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a dual sim phone however I received a single sim phone. This is totally totally unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Wendell A.

customer_reviews.title: Drops calls constantly, Nokia tries anyway possible to avoid honoring warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Drops calls constantly it's ridicules also Nokia looks for any reason now to not honor warranty it's not the Nokia of old it's not the N days anymore it's a shame.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS PHONE
customer_reviews.text: I gave this phone 1 star only because there not a no star option. Because of health issues and car issues, l just got it set up today. After about 6 hours, l picked up the phone and it was burning hot. And it wasn't even charging. I am out $200 because l will not be using the piece of junk!
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary McKeever

customer_reviews.title: It does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking screen. Quick response times. Speaker phone works poorly. People have a hard time hearing me. The speakers crackle sometimes. Also it will randomly lock during use. This does not happen very often.
customer_reviews.author: da_cheat87

customer_reviews.title: fingerprint reader rarely work
customer_reviews.text: the fingerprint reader does not work most of the time. The screen gets very hot quickly in summer.
customer_reviews.author: Tao Zheng

customer_reviews.title: It’s a new phone.
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be exactly what I was looking for! Although time will tell, I believe it is easier to use and adjusts readily to my needs. Excellent phone choice, good sound, great visuals.
customer_reviews.author: Noweda M.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: After a month it started randomly turning off until it finally died. The B2x warranty website does not recognize the IMEI number and so I can't get in contact with them. Avoid this phone.
customer_reviews.author: UsedthisItem

customer_reviews.title: price and quality
customer_reviews.text: I gave it a 4 star, but prefer to give it a 3 1/2 star instead. for 150- 160 dollars, its a relatively good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Nokia never again
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone, cause back in the days Nokia was one of the best brands of cell phone, this is not the truth anymore. This phone has all kinds of issues as well as other I got and I have contacted the Nokia Customer Service several times and no solution, they will redirect you to Amazon or someone else, don't waste your money and time.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Mena

customer_reviews.title: best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: thin, multi-freq, works all over the world, fast, dual SIM or micro SD memory. don't know why people pay thousand of dollars for samsung or apple.
customer_reviews.author: barry pham

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for me.
customer_reviews.text: The battery appears drain faster than expected. Other than that, I like the fact that it's UNLOCKED and I have 2 separate phone number's on the same phone. I don't have to buy/lug around/charge 2 phones. If James Brown were here, he'd say "Get Down"!!!
customer_reviews.author: Generically Speaking

customer_reviews.title: Sleek
customer_reviews.text: Sleek, no bloatware, and I've dropped it twice, no case, and its still in perfect condition. Nokia may have been bought out, but this product is an excellent use of their brand. I got the "no-ads" version.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Shpongleman

customer_reviews.title: No service
customer_reviews.text: Great phone if you don't mind having no signal and tons of dropped calls. The manual says to be careful not to cover the antenna while using, but it doesn't tell you where the antenna is! I'm sorry I bought this. It was a total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: ElinMarie

customer_reviews.title: Don't
customer_reviews.text: The design is nice with the aluminum back. I used this phone with care for 7 months and then puff; it wont take charge anymore. Money wasted. NOKIA cannot repair it. I don't think nokia phones are as good with cellphones as they were back in the days. I'm done with Nokia. May after you (the buyer) go through the same thing, then you will understand what I meant. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I waited so long for this... Only complain:camera can be much better then this.
customer_reviews.author: Pier

customer_reviews.title: Poor phone reliability and poor customer service - not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Nokia customer service is the worst. If you have a problem you are on your own so be warned. We have a number of these in our office and 1/3 of them have gone faulty within 12 months. We have stopped buying any Nokia products.
customer_reviews.author: Ratu Mason

customer_reviews.title: Nokia quality
customer_reviews.text: Does not have video and photo quality is not as great as my Nokia 925.
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Has the same screen size as the $900 iphone 8+ and looks better in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my Samsung 6 edge with this and I am pleasantly surprised. Has the same screen size as the $900 iphone 8+ and looks better in my opinion. No bloatware installed, great battery life, and great price. I highly recommend this phone!
customer_reviews.author: justin.nelson

customer_reviews.title: Nokia is coming back, to stay!
customer_reviews.text: Great budget phone. Built solid, as real Nokia, works well, looks good. My family switched back to Nokia phones and so far, planning to stay with Nokia products.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Love this phone , will get a little slow if you have multiple windows open though . Overall a great phone.
customer_reviews.author: Manda

customer_reviews.title: Great until it wasn’t.
customer_reviews.text: My first switch from Apple to android. Worked great for about 24 days, then just stopped working. Returned immediately and switched back to Apple. I’m not hardly a heavy daily user for my phone, but when I rely on my phone for alarms, I expect them to work and not shut off, never come on again, and lose all my data.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Barber

customer_reviews.title: The worst part is the reception
customer_reviews.text: The phone was okay cheap build but at this price? The worst part is the reception. Every other phone make at our home including my own a Sony and a Blu phone come in well. We are on Att network all other phones with Att seem to do fine its only this Nokia that has problem. I not sure what issue is whether built in antenna or what I would think the phone would be under warranty being only 4 months old but now I have no one to contact. If someone knows how let me know. I would not recommend this phone for great reception.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Nokia 6 TA-1025 32GB Unlocked GSM Android w/ 16MP Camera - Silver
product_meta.description: Nokia 6 brings leading craftsmanship in a product that is truly built to last. Bright vibrant 5.5” full HD IPS laminated display that makes watching videos a delight. It offers louder sound and deeper bass from the dual speakers and a smart amplifier to ensure a better entertainment experience.
feature_bullets: Fast 4G LTE speed, 1. 4 GHz Qualcomm Snapdragon 430 Octa-core processor, 3 GB of RAM, and 32 GB of internal memory with the option to add up to 128 GB of Micro SD expandable memory
Brilliant 5. 5” 2. 5D full HD display and a smart amplifier with 7. 2W peak output and Dolby atmos

16 MP rear-facing and 8 MP front-facing camera with dual-tone flash; 4G Volte, Wi-Fi 802. 11 b/G/openings, Bluetooth 4. 1, GPS, USB OTG support and a built-in fingerprint sensor grants you exclusive access to your Device
Full metal construction built from industrial grade aluminum so your device is safe and ready for anything
Enjoy the best of Android 9. 0 Pie with split screen view, Google play store, Google maps, Gmail, and Google assistant for hands-free voice commands. 2. 2 GHz

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars347 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Nokia MicroUSB Charger, Device, Quick start guide, Charging/data cable
